page.title: 05Shops.
page.content: Linslade is mainly a secondary shopping area, supplying the day to day needs of the local business and residential community. There are a well distributed number of grocery/general stores, opening from early morning (7.30a.m.) to late evening (9.30p.m.) in certain cases to accomodate early workers and late home coming commuters. There is a Sub Post Office attached to one of the general stores, thereby making it a more viable financial proposition. A small independent bakery exists side by side with a small branch of the Co-Operative Society and there is an excellent independent butcher who is also a local farmer breeding nearly all his own meat for slaughter and selling in the shop. He also sells game such as partridge, pheasant and rabbits shot by local inhabitants.
